instructions.name: admin_super_withdraw
docs: (Arena admin) used to withdraw funds from arena liquidity pools to sunset them. Only
hard-coded arena banks can call this function.

instructions.name: config_group_fee
docs: (global fee admin only) Enable or disable program fees for any group. Does not require the
group admin to sign: the global fee state admin can turn program fees on or off for any
group

accounts.name: global_fee_admin
docs: `global_fee_admin` of the FeeState

instructions.name: edit_global_fee_state
docs: (global fee admin only) Adjust fees, admin, or the destination wallet

accounts.name: global_fee_admin
docs: Admin of the global FeeState

accounts.name: marginfi_account
docs: Account under liquidation

accounts.name: liquidation_record
docs: The associated liquidation record PDA for the given `marginfi_account`

instructions.name: init_global_fee_state
docs: (Runs once per program) Configures the fee state account, where the global admin sets fees
that are assessed to the protocol

accounts.name: payer
docs: Pays the init fee

instructions.name: init_staked_settings
docs: (group admin only) Init the Staked Settings account, which is used to create staked
collateral banks, and must run before any staked collateral bank can be created with
`add_pool_permissionless`. Running this ix effectively opts the group into the staked
collateral feature.

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Pays the init fee

instructions.name: kamino_deposit
docs: (user) Deposit into a Kamino pool through a marginfi account
* amount - in the liquidity token (e.g. if there is a Kamino USDC bank, pass the amount of
USDC desired), in native decimals.

accounts.name: signer_token_account
docs: Owned by authority, the source account for the token deposit.

accounts.name: liquidity_vault_authority
docs: The bank's liquidity vault authority, which owns the Kamino obligation. Note: Kamino needs
this to be mut because `deposit` might return the rent here

accounts.name: liquidity_vault
docs: Used as an intermediary to deposit token into Kamino

accounts.name: kamino_reserve
docs: The Kamino reserve that holds liquidity

accounts.name: mint
docs: Bank's liquidity token mint (e.g., USDC). Kamino calls this the `reserve_liquidity_mint`

accounts.name: reserve_collateral_mint
docs: The reserve's mint for tokenized representations of Kamino deposits.

accounts.name: reserve_destination_deposit_collateral
docs: The reserve's destination for tokenized representations of deposits. Note: the
`reserve_collateral_mint` will mint tokens directly to this account.

accounts.name: obligation_farm_user_state
docs: Required if the Kamino reserve has an active farm.

accounts.name: reserve_farm_state
docs: Required if the Kamino reserve has an active farm.

accounts.name: farms_program
docs: Farms program for Kamino staking functionality

instructions.name: kamino_harvest_reward
docs: (fee admin only) Harvest the specified reward index from the Kamino Farm attached to this bank.
* `reward_index` — index of the reward token in the Kamino Farm's reward list

accounts.name: fee_state
docs: Global fee state that contains the global_fee_admin

accounts.name: destination_token_account
docs: Destination token account must be owned by the global fee admin

accounts.name: liquidity_vault_authority
docs: The bank's liquidity vault authority, which owns the Kamino obligation.

accounts.name: user_reward_ata
docs: An initialized ATA of type reward mint owned by liquidity vault

instructions.name: kamino_init_obligation
docs: (permissionless) Initialize a Kamino obligation for a marginfi bank
* amount - In token, in native decimals. Must be >10 (i.e. 10 lamports, not 10 tokens). Lost
forever. Generally, try to make this the equivalent of around $1, in case Kamino ever
rounds small balances down to zero.

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Pays to init the obligation and pays a nominal amount to ensure the obligation has a
non-zero balance.

accounts.name: signer_token_account
docs: The fee payer must provide a nominal amount of bank tokens so the obligation is not empty.
This amount is irrecoverable and and will prevent the obligation from ever being closed,
even if the bank is otherwise empty (Kamino normally closes empty obligations automatically)

accounts.name: liquidity_vault_authority
docs: The liquidity vault authority (PDA that will own the Kamino obligation). Note: Kamino needs
this to be mut because `deposit` might return the rent here

accounts.name: liquidity_vault
docs: Used as an intermediary to deposit a nominal amount of token into the obligation.

accounts.name: kamino_obligation
docs: The obligation account to be created. Note that the key was already derived when
initializing the bank, and this must match the obligation recorded at that time.

accounts.name: mint
docs: Bank's liquidity token mint (e.g., USDC). Kamino calls this the `reserve_liquidity_mint`

accounts.name: reserve_collateral_mint
docs: The reserve's mint for tokenized representations of Kamino deposits.

accounts.name: reserve_destination_deposit_collateral
docs: The reserve's destination for tokenized representations of deposits. Note: the
`reserve_collateral_mint` will mint tokens directly to this account.

accounts.name: obligation_farm_user_state
docs: Required if the Kamino reserve has an active farm.

accounts.name: reserve_farm_state
docs: Required if the Kamino reserve has an active farm.

accounts.name: farms_program
docs: Farms program for Kamino staking functionality

accounts.name: collateral_token_program
docs: Note: the collateral token always uses Token classic, never Token22.

accounts.name: liquidity_token_program
docs: Note: Kamino does not have full Token22 support, certain Token22 features are disallowed.
Expect this to update over time. Check with the Kamino source.

instructions.name: kamino_withdraw
docs: (user) Withdraw from a Kamino pool through a marginfi account
* amount - in the collateral token (NOT liquidity token), in native decimals. Must convert
from collateral to liquidity token amounts using the current exchange rate.
* withdraw_all - if true, withdraw the entire mrgn balance (Note: due to rounding down, a
deposit and withdraw back to back may result in several lamports less)

accounts.name: destination_token_account
docs: Token account that will get tokens back
WARN: Completely unchecked!

accounts.name: lending_market
docs: The Kamino lending market

accounts.name: lending_market_authority
docs: The Kamino lending market authority

accounts.name: kamino_reserve
docs: The Kamino reserve that holds liquidity

accounts.name: reserve_liquidity_mint
docs: The liquidity token mint (e.g., USDC)
Needs serde to get the mint decimals for transfer checked

accounts.name: reserve_liquidity_supply
docs: The reserve's liquidity supply account

accounts.name: reserve_collateral_mint
docs: The reserve's collateral mint

accounts.name: reserve_source_collateral
docs: The reserve's source for collateral tokens

accounts.name: obligation_farm_user_state
docs: Optional farms accounts for Kamino staking functionality

accounts.name: farms_program
docs: Farms program for Kamino staking functionality

accounts.name: collateral_token_program
docs: The token program for the collateral token

accounts.name: liquidity_token_program
docs: The token program for the liquidity token

accounts.name: instruction_sysvar_account
docs: Used by kamino validate CPI calls

instructions.name: lending_account_liquidate
docs: Liquidate a lending account balance of an unhealthy marginfi account

instructions.name: lending_account_pulse_health
docs: (Permissionless) Refresh the internal risk engine health cache. Useful for liquidators and
other consumers that want to see the internal risk state of a user account. This cache is
read-only and serves no purpose except being populated by this ix.
* remaining accounts expected in the same order as borrow, etc. I.e., for each balance the
user has, pass bank and oracle: <bank1, oracle1, bank2, oracle2>

accounts.name: authority
docs: Must be marginfi_account's authority, unless in liquidation receivership
Note: during liquidation, there are no signer checks whatsoever: any key can repay as
long as the invariants checked at the end of liquidation are met.

instructions.name: lending_account_sort_balances
docs: (Permissionless) Sorts the lending account balances in descending order and removes the "gaps"
(i.e. inactive balances in between the active ones), if any.
This is necessary to ensure any legacy marginfi accounts are compliant with the
"gapless and sorted" requirements we now have.

accounts.name: authority
docs: Must be marginfi_account's authority, unless in liquidation receivership
Note: during liquidation, there are no signer checks whatsoever: any key can repay as
long as the invariants checked at the end of liquidation are met.

accounts.name: destination_account
docs: registered on `marginfi_account`

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Pays to init accounts and pays `fee_state.bank_init_flat_sol_fee` lamports to the protocol

instructions.name: lending_pool_add_bank_kamino
docs: (group admin only) Add a Kamino bank to the group. Pass the oracle and reserve in remaining
accounts 0 and 1 respectively.

accounts.name: bank_mint
docs: Must match the mint used by `kamino_reserve`, Kamino calls this the `reserve_liquidity_mint`
aka `liquidity.mint_pubkey`

accounts.name: kamino_obligation
docs: Note: not yet initialized in this instruction, run `init_obligation` after.

accounts.name: liquidity_vault_authority
docs: Will be authority of the bank's `kamino_obligation`. Note: When depositing/withdrawing
Kamino assets, the source/destination must also be owned by the obligation authority. This
account owns the `liquidity_vault`, and thus acts as intermediary for deposits/withdraws

accounts.name: liquidity_vault
docs: For Kamino banks, the `liquidity_vault` never holds assets, but is instead used as an
intermediary when depositing/withdrawing, e.g., withdrawn funds move from Kamino -> here ->
the user's token account.

accounts.name: insurance_vault_authority
docs: Note: Currently does nothing.

accounts.name: insurance_vault
docs: Note: Currently does nothing.

accounts.name: fee_vault_authority
docs: Note: Currently does nothing.

accounts.name: fee_vault
docs: Note: Currently does nothing.

accounts.name: bank_mint
docs: Mint of the spl-single-pool LST (a PDA derived from `stake_pool`)
because the sol_pool and stake_pool will not derive to a valid PDA which is also owned by
the staking program and spl-single-pool program.

accounts.name: stake_pool
docs: this key.
If derives the same `bank_mint`, then this must be the correct stake pool for that mint, and
we can subsequently use it to validate the `sol_pool`

instructions.name: lending_pool_add_bank_with_seed
docs: A copy of lending_pool_add_bank with an additional bank seed.
This seed is used to create a PDA for the bank's signature.
lending_pool_add_bank is preserved for backwards compatibility.

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Pays to init accounts and pays `fee_state.bank_init_flat_sol_fee` lamports to the protocol

accounts.name: fee_ata
docs: (validated in handler). Must already exist, may require initializing the ATA if it does not
already exist prior to this ix.

instructions.name: lending_pool_configure_bank
docs: (admin only)

instructions.name: lending_pool_configure_bank_emode
docs: (emode_admin only)

instructions.name: lending_pool_configure_bank_interest_only
docs: (delegate_curve_admin only)

instructions.name: lending_pool_configure_bank_limits_only
docs: (delegate_limits_admin only)

instructions.name: lending_pool_configure_bank_oracle
docs: (admin only)

instructions.name: lending_pool_handle_bankruptcy
docs: Handle bad debt of a bankrupt marginfi account for a given bank.

accounts.name: signer
docs: PERMISSIONLESS_BAD_DEBT_SETTLEMENT_FLAG is not set

instructions.name: lending_pool_setup_emissions
docs: (delegate_emissions_admin only)

accounts.name: emissions_funding_account
docs: NOTE: This is a TokenAccount, spl transfer will validate it.

instructions.name: lending_pool_update_emissions_parameters
docs: (delegate_emissions_admin only)

accounts.name: destination_account
docs: Bank fees will be sent to this account which must be an ATA of the bank's mint.

instructions.name: marginfi_account_initialize
docs: Initialize a marginfi account for a given group. The account is a fresh keypair, and must
sign. If you are a CPI caller, consider using `marginfi_account_initialize_pda` instead, or
create the account manually and use `transfer_to_new_account` to gift it to the owner you
wish.

instructions.name: marginfi_account_initialize_pda
docs: The same as `marginfi_account_initialize`, except the created marginfi account uses a PDA
(Program Derived Address)
seeds:
- marginfi_group
- authority: The account authority (owner)
- account_index: A u16 value to allow multiple accounts per authority
- third_party_id: Optional u16 for third-party tagging. Seeds < PDA_FREE_THRESHOLD can be
used freely. For a dedicated seed used by just your program (via CPI), contact us.

accounts.name: instructions_sysvar
docs: Instructions sysvar for CPI validation

accounts.name: destination_account
docs: User's earned emissions will be sent to the canonical ATA of this wallet.

accounts.name: global_fee_admin
docs: Admin of the global FeeState (can trigger panic pause)

accounts.name: fee_state
docs: Global fee state account containing the panic state

accounts.name: global_fee_admin
docs: Admin of the global FeeState (can manually unpause)

instructions.name: panic_unpause_permissionless
docs: (permissionless) Unpause the protocol when pause time has expired

instructions.name: propagate_fee_state
docs: (Permissionless) Force any group to adopt the current FeeState settings

accounts.name: marginfi_group
docs: Any group, this ix is permisionless and can propagate the fee to any group

accounts.name: marginfi_account
docs: Account under liquidation

accounts.name: liquidation_record
docs: The associated liquidation record PDA for the given `marginfi_account`

accounts.name: liquidation_receiver
docs: This account will have the authority to withdraw/repay as if they are the user authority
until the end of the tx.

instructions.name: transfer_to_new_account_pda
docs: Same as `transfer_to_new_account` except the resulting account is a PDA
seeds:
- marginfi_group
- authority: The account authority (owner)
- account_index: A u32 value to allow multiple accounts per authority
- third_party_id: Optional u32 for third-party tagging. Seeds < PDA_FREE_THRESHOLD can be
used freely. For a dedicated seed used by just your program (via CPI), contact us.

accounts.name: instructions_sysvar
docs: Instructions sysvar for CPI validation

errors.name: MissingPythOrBankAccount
errors.msg: Missing Oracle, Bank, LST mint, or Sol Pool

errors.name: RiskEngineInitRejected
errors.msg: RiskEngine rejected due to either bad health or stale oracles

errors.name: LendingAccountBalanceSlotsFull
errors.msg: Lending account balance slots are full

errors.name: ZeroLiquidationAmount
errors.msg: Amount to liquidate must be positive

errors.name: BalanceNotBadDebt
errors.msg: Account balance is not bad debt

errors.name: IsolatedAccountIllegalState
errors.msg: Account can have only one liability when account is under isolated risk

errors.name: CannotCloseOutstandingEmissions
errors.msg: Cannot close balance because of outstanding emissions

errors.name: AccountTempActiveBalanceLimitExceeded
errors.msg: Account can't temporarily open 3 balances, please close a balance first

errors.name: T22MintRequired
errors.msg: Token22 Banks require mint account as first remaining account

errors.name: InvalidFeeAta
errors.msg: Invalid ATA for global fee account

errors.name: AssetTagMismatch
errors.msg: Staked SOL accounts can only deposit staked assets and borrow SOL

errors.name: StakePoolValidationFailed
errors.msg: Stake pool validation failed: check the stake pool, mint, or sol pool

errors.name: WrongNumberOfOracleAccounts
errors.msg: Oracle error: wrong number of accounts

errors.name: PythPushWrongAccountOwner
errors.msg: Pyth Push oracle: wrong account owner

errors.name: StakedPythPushWrongAccountOwner
errors.msg: Staked Pyth Push oracle: wrong account owner

errors.name: OracleMaxConfidenceExceeded
errors.msg: Oracle max confidence exceeded: try again later

errors.name: PythPushInsufficientVerificationLevel
errors.msg: Pyth Push oracle: insufficient verification level

errors.name: SameAssetAndLiabilityBanks
errors.msg: Asset and liability bank cannot be the same

errors.name: OverliquidationAttempt
errors.msg: Trying to withdraw more assets than available

errors.name: HealthyAccount
errors.msg: Account is healthy and cannot be liquidated

errors.name: ExhaustedLiability
errors.msg: Liability payoff too severe, exhausted liability

errors.name: TooSeverePayoff
errors.msg: Liability payoff too severe, liability balance has assets

errors.name: TooSevereLiquidation
errors.msg: Liquidation too severe, account above maintenance requirement

errors.name: ArenaBankLimit
errors.msg: Arena groups can only support two banks

errors.name: ArenaSettingCannotChange
errors.msg: Arena groups cannot return to non-arena status

errors.name: PythPushInvalidWindowSize
errors.msg: TWAP window size does not match expected duration

errors.name: BankCannotClose
errors.msg: Banks cannot close when they have open positions or emissions outstanding

errors.name: BankKilledByBankruptcy
errors.msg: Bank killed by bankruptcy: bank shutdown and value of all holdings is zero

errors.name: UnexpectedLiquidationState
errors.msg: Liquidation state issue. Check start before end, end last, and both unique

errors.name: StartNotFirst
errors.msg: Liquidation start must be first instruction (other than compute program ixes)

errors.name: StartRepeats
errors.msg: Only one liquidation event allowed per tx

errors.name: EndNotLast
errors.msg: The end instruction must be the last ix in the tx

errors.name: ForbiddenIx
errors.msg: Tried to call an instruction that is forbidden during liquidation

errors.name: LiquidationPremiumTooHigh
errors.msg: Seized too much of the asset relative to liability repaid

errors.name: NotAllowedInCPI
errors.msg: Start and end liquidation and flashloan must be top-level instructions

errors.name: WrongAssetTagForStandardInstructions
errors.msg: Wrong asset tag for standard instructions, expected DEFAULT, SOL, or STAKED asset tag

errors.name: WrongAssetTagForKaminoInstructions
errors.msg: Wrong asset tag for Kamino instructions, expected KAMINO asset tag

errors.name: CantAddPool
errors.msg: Cannot create a kamino bank with this instruction, use add_bank_kamino

errors.name: KaminoReserveMintAddressMismatch
errors.msg: Kamino reserve mint address doesn't match the bank mint address

errors.name: KaminoDepositFailed
errors.msg: Deposit failed: obligation deposit amount increase did not match the expected increase, left - actual, right - expected

errors.name: KaminoWithdrawFailed
errors.msg: Withdraw failed: token vault increase did not match the expected increase, left - actual, right - expected

errors.name: ReserveStale
errors.msg: Kamino Reserve data is stale - run refresh_reserve on kamino program first

errors.name: InvalidObligationDepositCount
errors.msg: Kamino obligation must have exactly one active deposit, at index 0

errors.name: ObligationDepositReserveMismatch
errors.msg: Kamino obligation deposit doesn't match the expected reserve

errors.name: ObligationInitDepositInsufficient
errors.msg: Failed to meet minimum deposit amount requirement for init obligation

errors.name: KaminoInvalidOracleSetup
errors.msg: Invalid oracle setup: only KaminoPythPush and KaminoSwitchboardPull are supported

fields.name: bank_asset_tag
docs: Inherited from the bank when the position is first created and CANNOT BE CHANGED after that.
Note that all balances created before the addition of this feature use `ASSET_TAG_DEFAULT`

fields.name: asset_share_value
docs: Monotonically increases as interest rate accumulates. For typical banks, a user's asset
value in token = (number of shares the user has * asset_share_value).
* A float (arbitrary decimals)
* Initially 1

fields.name: liability_share_value
docs: Monotonically increases as interest rate accumulates. For typical banks, a user's liabilty
value in token = (number of shares the user has * liability_share_value)
* A float (arbitrary decimals)
* Initially 1

fields.name: collected_insurance_fees_outstanding
docs: Fees collected and pending withdraw for the `insurance_vault`

fields.name: collected_group_fees_outstanding
docs: Fees collected and pending withdraw for the `fee_vault`

fields.name: total_liability_shares
docs: Sum of all liability shares held by all borrowers in this bank.
* Uses `mint_decimals`

fields.name: total_asset_shares
docs: Sum of all asset shares held by all depositors in this bank.
* Uses `mint_decimals`
* For Kamino banks, this is the quantity of collateral tokens (NOT liquidity tokens) in the
bank, and also uses `mint_decimals`, though the mint itself will always show (6) decimals
exactly (i.e Kamino ignores this and treats it as if it was using `mint_decimals`)

fields.name: flags
docs: Bank Config Flags
- EMISSIONS_FLAG_BORROW_ACTIVE: 1
- EMISSIONS_FLAG_LENDING_ACTIVE: 2
- PERMISSIONLESS_BAD_DEBT_SETTLEMENT: 4
- FREEZE_SETTINGS: 8

fields.name: emissions_rate
docs: Emissions APR. Number of emitted tokens (emissions_mint) per 1e(bank.mint_decimal) tokens
(bank mint) (native amount) per 1 YEAR.

fields.name: collected_program_fees_outstanding
docs: Fees collected and pending withdraw for the `FeeState.global_fee_wallet`'s canonical ATA for `mint`

fields.name: emode
docs: Controls this bank's emode configuration, which enables some banks to treat the assets of
certain other banks more preferentially as collateral.

fields.name: fees_destination_account
docs: Set with `update_fees_destination_account`. Fees can be withdrawn to the canonical ATA of
this wallet without the admin's input (withdraw_fees_permissionless). If pubkey default, the
bank doesn't support this feature, and the fees must be collected manually (withdraw_fees).

fields.name: lending_position_count
docs: Number of user lending positions currently open in this bank
* For banks created prior to 0.1.4, this is the number of positions opened/closed after
0.1.4 goes live, and may be negative.
* For banks created in 0.1.4 or later, this is the number of positions open in total, and
the bank may safely be closed if this is zero. Will never go negative.

fields.name: borrowing_position_count
docs: Number of user borrowing positions currently open in this bank
* For banks created prior to 0.1.4, this is the number of positions opened/closed after
0.1.4 goes live, and may be negative.
* For banks created in 0.1.4 or later, this is the number of positions open in total, and
the bank may safely be closed if this is zero. Will never go negative.

fields.name: kamino_reserve
docs: Kamino banks only, otherwise Pubkey default

fields.name: kamino_obligation
docs: Kamino banks only, otherwise Pubkey default

types.name: BankCache
docs: A read-only cache of the bank's key metrics, e.g. spot interest/fee rates.

fields.name: base_rate
docs: Actual (spot) interest/fee rates of the bank, based on utilization
* APR (annual percentage rate) values

fields.name: lending_rate
docs: Equivalent to `base_rate` * utilization

fields.name: borrowing_rate
docs: Equivalent to `base_rate` * (1 + ir_fees) + fixed_fees

fields.name: interest_accumulated_for
docs: * in seconds

fields.name: accumulated_since_last_update
docs: equivalent to (share value increase in the last `interest_accumulated_for` seconds *
shares), i.e. the delta in `asset_share_value`, in token.
* Note: if the tx that triggered this cache update increased or decreased the net shares,
this value still reports using the PRE-CHANGE share amount, since interest is always
earned on that amount.
* in token, in native decimals, as I80F48

fields.name: asset_weight_init
docs: TODO: Convert weights to (u64, u64) to avoid precision loss (maybe?)

fields.name: asset_tag
docs: Determines what kinds of assets users of this bank can interact with.
Options:
* ASSET_TAG_DEFAULT (0) - A regular asset that can be comingled with any other regular asset
or with `ASSET_TAG_SOL`
* ASSET_TAG_SOL (1) - Accounts with a SOL position can comingle with **either**
`ASSET_TAG_DEFAULT` or `ASSET_TAG_STAKED` positions, but not both
* ASSET_TAG_STAKED (2) - Staked SOL assets. Accounts with a STAKED position can only deposit
other STAKED assets or SOL (`ASSET_TAG_SOL`) and can only borrow SOL

fields.name: config_flags
docs: Flags for various config options
* 1 - Always set if bank created in 0.1.4 or later, or if migrated to the new pyth
oracle setup from a prior version. Not set in 0.1.3 or earlier banks using pyth that have
not yet migrated. Does nothing for banks that use switchboard.
* 2, 4, 8, 16, etc - reserved for future use.

fields.name: total_asset_value_init_limit
docs: USD denominated limit for calculating asset value for initialization margin requirements.
Example, if total SOL deposits are equal to $1M and the limit it set to $500K,
then SOL assets will be discounted by 50%.
In other words the max value of liabilities that can be backed by the asset is $500K.
This is useful for limiting the damage of orcale attacks.
Value is UI USD value, for example value 100 -> $100

fields.name: oracle_max_age
docs: Time window in seconds for the oracle price feed to be considered live.

fields.name: oracle_max_confidence
docs: From 0-100%, if the confidence exceeds this value, the oracle is considered invalid. Note:
the confidence adjustment is capped at 5% regardless of this value.
* 0 falls back to using the default 10% instead, i.e., U32_MAX_DIV_10

types.name: BankConfigCompact
docs: TODO: Convert weights to (u64, u64) to avoid precision loss (maybe?)

fields.name: asset_tag
docs: Determines what kinds of assets users of this bank can interact with.
Options:
* ASSET_TAG_DEFAULT (0) - A regular asset that can be comingled with any other regular asset
or with `ASSET_TAG_SOL`
* ASSET_TAG_SOL (1) - Accounts with a SOL position can comingle with **either**
`ASSET_TAG_DEFAULT` or `ASSET_TAG_STAKED` positions, but not both
* ASSET_TAG_STAKED (2) - Staked SOL assets. Accounts with a STAKED position can only deposit
other STAKED assets or SOL (`ASSET_TAG_SOL`) and can only borrow SOL

fields.name: config_flags
docs: Flags for various config options
* 1 - Always set if bank created in 0.1.4 or later, or if migrated to the new oracle
setup from a prior version. Not set in 0.1.3 or earlier banks that have not yet migrated.
* 2, 4, 8, 16, etc - reserved for future use.

fields.name: total_asset_value_init_limit
docs: USD denominated limit for calculating asset value for initialization margin requirements.
Example, if total SOL deposits are equal to $1M and the limit it set to $500K,
then SOL assets will be discounted by 50%.
In other words the max value of liabilities that can be backed by the asset is $500K.
This is useful for limiting the damage of orcale attacks.
Value is UI USD value, for example value 100 -> $100

fields.name: oracle_max_age
docs: Time window in seconds for the oracle price feed to be considered live.

fields.name: oracle_max_confidence
docs: From 0-100%, if the confidence exceeds this value, the oracle is considered invalid. Note:
the confidence adjustment is capped at 5% regardless of this value.
* 0% = use the default (10%)

types.name: EmodeConfig
docs: An emode configuration. Each bank has one such configuration, but this may also be the
intersection of many configurations (see `reconcile_emode_configs`). For example, the risk
engine creates such an intersection from all the emode config of all banks the user is borrowing
from.

fields.name: collateral_bank_emode_tag
docs: emode_tag of the bank(s) whose collateral you wish to treat preferentially.

fields.name: flags
docs: * APPLIES_TO_ISOLATED (1) - (NOT YET IMPLEMENTED) if set, isolated banks with this tag
also benefit. If not set, isolated banks continue to offer zero collateral, even if they
use this tag.
* 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc - reserved for future use

fields.name: asset_weight_init
docs: Note: If set below the collateral bank's weight, does nothing.

fields.name: asset_weight_maint
docs: Note: If set below the collateral bank's weight, does nothing.

types.name: EmodeSettings
docs: Controls the bank's e-mode configuration, allowing certain collateral sources to be treated more
favorably as collateral when used to borrow from this bank.

fields.name: emode_tag
docs: This bank's NON-unique id that other banks will use to determine what emode rate to use when
this bank is offered as collateral.
For example, all stablecoin banks might share the same emode_tag, and in their entries, each
such stablecoin bank will recognize that collateral sources with this "stable" tag get
preferential weights. When a new stablecoin is added that is considered riskier, it may get
a new, less favorable emode tag, and eventually get upgraded to the same one as the other
stables
* 0 is in an invalid tag and will do nothing.

fields.name: timestamp
docs: Unix timestamp from the system clock when emode state was last updated

fields.name: flags
docs: EMODE_ON (1) - If set, at least one entry is configured
2, 4, 8, etc, Reserved for future use

types.name: FeeState
docs: Unique per-program. The Program Owner uses this account to administrate fees collected by the protocol

fields.name: key
docs: The fee state's own key. A PDA derived from just `b"feestate"`

fields.name: global_fee_admin
docs: Can modify fees

fields.name: global_fee_wallet
docs: The base wallet for all protocol fees. All SOL fees go to this wallet. All non-SOL fees go
to the cannonical ATA of this wallet for that asset.

fields.name: bank_init_flat_sol_fee
docs: Flat fee assessed when a new bank is initialized, in lamports.
* In SOL, in native decimals.

fields.name: liquidation_max_fee
docs: Liquidators can claim at this premium, when liquidating an asset in receivership
liquidation, e.g. (1 + this) * amount repaid <= asset seized
* A percentage

fields.name: program_fee_fixed
docs: Fee collected by the program owner from all groups
* A percentage

fields.name: program_fee_rate
docs: Fee collected by the program owner from all groups
* A percentage

fields.name: panic_state
docs: When the global admin pauses the protocol in the event of an emergency, information about
the pause duration will be stored here and propagated to groups.

fields.name: liquidation_flat_sol_fee
docs: Flat fee assessed for insurance/program use when a liquidation is executed
* In SOL, in native decimals.

types.name: HealthCache
docs: A read-only cache of the internal risk engine's information. Only valid in borrow/withdraw if
the tx does not fail. To see the state in any context, e.g. to figure out if the risk engine is
failing due to some bad price information, use `pulse_health`.

fields.name: asset_value
docs: Internal risk engine asset value, using initial weight (e.g. what is used for borrowing
purposes), with all confidence adjustments, and other discounts on price.
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

fields.name: liability_value
docs: Internal risk engine liability value, using initial weight (e.g. what is used for borrowing
purposes), with all confidence adjustments, and other discounts on price.
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

fields.name: asset_value_maint
docs: Internal risk engine asset value, using maintenance weight (e.g. what is used for
liquidation purposes), with all confidence adjustments.
* Zero if the risk engine failed to load
* Uses SPOT price
* In dollars

fields.name: liability_value_maint
docs: Internal risk engine liability value, using maintenance weight (e.g. what is used for
liquidation purposes), with all confidence adjustments.
* Zero if the risk engine failed to load
* Uses SPOT price
* In dollars

fields.name: asset_value_equity
docs: The "true" value of assets without any confidence or weight adjustments. Internally, used
only for bankruptcies.
* Zero if the risk engine failed to load
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

fields.name: liability_value_equity
docs: The "true" value of liabilities without any confidence or weight adjustments.
Internally, used only for bankruptcies.
* Zero if the risk engine failed to load
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

fields.name: timestamp
docs: Unix timestamp from the system clock when this cache was last updated

fields.name: flags
docs: The flags that indicate the state of the health cache. This is a u64 bitfield, where each
bit represents a flag.
* HEALTHY = 1 - If set, the account cannot be liquidated. If 0, the account is unhealthy and
can be liquidated.
* ENGINE STATUS = 2 - If set, the engine did not error during the last health pulse. If 0,
the engine would have errored and this cache is likely invalid. `RiskEngineInitRejected`
is ignored and will allow the flag to be set anyways.
* ORACLE OK = 4 - If set, the engine did not error due to an oracle issue. If 0, engine was
passed a bad bank or oracle account, or an oracle was stale. Check the order in which
accounts were passed and ensure each balance has the correct banks/oracles, and that
oracle cranks ran recently enough. Check `internal_err` and `err_index` for more details
in some circumstances. Invalid if generated after borrow/withdraw (these instructions will
ignore oracle issues if health is still satisfactory with some balance zeroed out).
* 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, etc - reserved for future use

fields.name: mrgn_err
docs: If the engine errored, look here for the error code. If the engine returns ok, you may also
check here to see if the risk engine rejected this tx (3009).

fields.name: prices
docs: Each price corresponds to that index of Balances in the LendingAccount. Useful for debugging
or liquidator consumption, to determine how a user's position is priced internally.
* An f64 stored as bytes

fields.name: internal_err
docs: Errors in asset oracles are ignored (with prices treated as zero). If you see a zero price
and the `ORACLE_OK` flag is not set, check here to see what error was ignored internally.

fields.name: err_index
docs: Index in `balances` where `internal_err` appeared

fields.name: program_version
docs: Since 0.1.3, the version will be encoded here. See PROGRAM_VERSION.

fields.name: insurance_fee_fixed_apr
docs: Goes to insurance, funds `collected_insurance_fees_outstanding`

fields.name: insurance_ir_fee
docs: Goes to insurance, funds `collected_insurance_fees_outstanding`

fields.name: protocol_fixed_fee_apr
docs: Earned by the group, goes to `collected_group_fees_outstanding`

fields.name: protocol_ir_fee
docs: Earned by the group, goes to `collected_group_fees_outstanding`

types.name: KaminoConfigCompact
docs: Used to configure Kamino banks. A simplified version of `BankConfigCompact` which omits most
values related to interest since Kamino banks cannot earn interest or be borrowed against.

fields.name: oracle_setup
docs: Either `KaminoPythPush` or `KaminoSwitchboardPull`

fields.name: operational_state
docs: Bank operational state - allows starting banks in paused state

fields.name: risk_tier
docs: Risk tier - determines if assets can be borrowed in isolation

fields.name: config_flags
docs: Config flags for future-proofing

fields.name: oracle_max_age
docs: Currently unused: Kamino's oracle age applies to kamino banks.

fields.name: oracle_max_confidence
docs: Oracle confidence threshold (0 = use default 10%)

fields.name: asset_value_maint
docs: Internal risk engine asset value snapshot taken when liquidation begins, using maintenance
weight with all confidence adjustments.
* Uses SPOT price
* In dollars

fields.name: liability_value_maint
docs: Internal risk engine liability value snapshot taken when liquidation begins, using
maintenance weight with all confidence adjustments.
* Uses SPOT price
* In dollars

fields.name: asset_value_equity
docs: Actual cash value of assets pre-liquidation (inclusive of price adjustment for oracle
confidence, but without any weights)
* Liquidator is allowed to seize up to `liability_value_equity` - this amount
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

fields.name: liability_value_equity
docs: Actual cash value of liabilities pre-liquidation (inclusive of price adjustment for oracle
confidence, but without any weights)
* Liquidator is allowed to seize up to this amount - `asset_value_equity`
* Uses EMA price
* In dollars

types.name: LiquidationEntry
docs: Used to record key details of the last few liquidation events on the account

fields.name: asset_amount_seized
docs: Dollar amount seized
* An f64 stored as bytes

fields.name: liab_amount_repaid
docs: Dollar amount repaid
* An f64 stored as bytes

fields.name: key
docs: This account's own key. A PDA derived from `marginfi_account`

fields.name: marginfi_account
docs: Account this record tracks

fields.name: record_payer
docs: The key that paid to create this account. At some point, we may allow this wallet to reclaim
the rent paid to open a record.

fields.name: liquidation_receiver
docs: The liquidator taking receivership of the `marginfi_account` to complete a liquidation. Pays
the liquidation fee.
* Always pubkey default unless actively within a liquidation event.

fields.name: entries
docs: Basic historical data for the last few liquidation events on this account

fields.name: account_flags
docs: The flags that indicate the state of the account. This is u64 bitfield, where each bit
represents a flag.
Flags:MarginfiAccount
- 1: `ACCOUNT_DISABLED` - Indicates that the account is disabled and no further actions can
be taken on it.
- 2: `ACCOUNT_IN_FLASHLOAN` - Only set when an account is within a flash loan, e.g. when
start_flashloan is called, then unset when the flashloan ends.
- 4: `ACCOUNT_FLAG_DEPRECATED` - Deprecated, available for future use
- 8: `ACCOUNT_TRANSFER_AUTHORITY_DEPRECATED` - the admin has flagged with account to be
moved, original owner can now call `set_account_transfer_authority`
- 16: `ACCOUNT_IN_RECEIVERSHIP` - the account is eligible to be liquidated and has entered
receivership, a liquidator is able to control borrows and withdraws until the end of the
tx. This flag will only appear within a tx.

fields.name: emissions_destination_account
docs: Set with `update_emissions_destination_account`. Emissions rewards can be withdrawn to the
cannonical ATA of this wallet without the user's input (withdraw_emissions_permissionless).
If pubkey default, the user has not opted into this feature, and must claim emissions
manually (withdraw_emissions).

fields.name: migrated_from
docs: If this account was migrated from another one, store the original account key

fields.name: migrated_to
docs: If this account has been migrated to another one, store the destination account key

fields.name: account_index
docs: If a PDA-based account, the account index, a seed used to derive the PDA that can be chosen
arbitrarily (0.1.5 or later). Otherwise, does nothing.

fields.name: third_party_index
docs: If a PDA-based account (0.1.5 or later), a "vendor specific" id. Values < PDA_FREE_THRESHOLD
can be used by anyone with no restrictions. Values >= PDA_FREE_THRESHOLD can only be used by
a particular program via CPI. These values require being added to a list, contact us for
more details. For legacy non-pda accounts, does nothing.
Note: use a unique seed to tag accounts related to some particular program or campaign so
you can easily fetch them all later.

fields.name: bump
docs: This account's bump, if a PDA-based account (0.1.5 or later). Otherwise, does nothing.

fields.name: liquidation_record
docs: Stores information related to liquidations made against this account. A pda of this
account's key, and "liq_record"
* Typically pubkey default if this account has never been liquidated or close to liquidation
* Opening this account is permissionless. Typically the liquidator pays, but e.g. we may
also charge the user if they are opening a risky position on the front end.

fields.name: admin
docs: Broadly able to modify anything, and can set/remove other admins at will.

fields.name: group_flags
docs: Bitmask for group settings flags.
* 0: `PROGRAM_FEES_ENABLED` If set, program-level fees are enabled.
* 1: `ARENA_GROUP` If set, this is an arena group, which can only have two banks
* Bits 2-63: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: fee_state_cache
docs: Caches information from the global `FeeState` so the FeeState can be omitted on certain ixes

fields.name: emode_admin
docs: This admin can configure collateral ratios above (but not below) the collateral ratio of
certain banks , e.g. allow SOL to count as 90% collateral when borrowing an LST instead of
the default rate.

fields.name: delegate_limit_admin
docs: Can modify the `deposit_limit`, `borrow_limit`, `total_asset_value_init_limit` but nothing
else, for every bank under this group

fields.name: delegate_emissions_admin
docs: Can modify the emissions `flags`, `emissions_rate` and `emissions_mint`, but nothing else,
for every bank under this group

fields.name: panic_state_cache
docs: When program keeper temporarily puts the program into panic mode, information about the
duration of the lockup will be available here.

types.name: MinimalObligation
docs: A minimal copy of Kamino's Obligation for zero-copy deserialization

fields.name: last_update_slot
docs: Kamino obligations are only good for one slot, e.g. `refresh_obligation` must have run within the
same slot as any ix that needs a non-stale obligation e.g. withdraw.

fields.name: last_update_stale
docs: True if the obligation is stale, which will cause various ixes like withdraw to fail. Typically
set to true in any tx that modifies obligation balance, and set to false at the end of a
successful `refresh_obligation`
* 0 = false, 1 = true

fields.name: last_update_price_status
docs: Each bit represents a passed check in price status.
* 63 = all checks passed
Otherwise:
* PRICE_LOADED =        0b_0000_0001; // 1
* PRICE_AGE_CHECKED =   0b_0000_0010; // 2
* TWAP_CHECKED =        0b_0000_0100; // 4
* TWAP_AGE_CHECKED =    0b_0000_1000; // 8
* HEURISTIC_CHECKED =   0b_0001_0000; // 16
* PRICE_USAGE_ALLOWED = 0b_0010_0000; // 32

fields.name: owner
docs: For mrgn banks, the bank's Liquidity Vault Authority (a pda which can be derived if the bank
key is known)

fields.name: deposited_amount
docs: In collateral token (NOT liquidity token), use `collateral_to_liquidity` to convert back to
liquidity token!
* Always 6 decimals

fields.name: market_value_sf
docs: * In dollars, based on last oracle price update
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.
* A float (arbitrary decimals)

fields.name: slot
docs: Kamino reserves are only good for one slot, e.g. `refresh_reserve` must have run within the
same slot as any ix that needs a non-stale reserve e.g. withdraw.

fields.name: stale
docs: True if the reserve is stale, which will cause various ixes like withdraw to fail. Typically
set to true in any tx that modifies reserve balance, and set to false at the end of a
successful `refresh_reserve`
* 0 = false, 1 = true

fields.name: price_status
docs: Each bit represents a passed check in price status.
* 63 = all checks passed
Otherwise:
* PRICE_LOADED =        0b_0000_0001; // 1
* PRICE_AGE_CHECKED =   0b_0000_0010; // 2
* TWAP_CHECKED =        0b_0000_0100; // 4
* TWAP_AGE_CHECKED =    0b_0000_1000; // 8
* HEURISTIC_CHECKED =   0b_0001_0000; // 16
* PRICE_USAGE_ALLOWED = 0b_0010_0000; // 32

fields.name: supply_vault
docs: * A PDA

fields.name: fee_vault
docs: * A PDA

fields.name: available_amount
docs: In simple terms: (amount in supply vault - outstanding borrows)
* In token, with `mint_decimals`

fields.name: borrowed_amount_sf
docs: * In token, with `mint_decimals`
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: market_price_sf
docs: * Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: accumulated_protocol_fees_sf
docs: * In token, with `mint_decimals`
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: accumulated_referrer_fees_sf
docs: * In token, with `mint_decimals`
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: pending_referrer_fees_sf
docs: * In token, with `mint_decimals`
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: absolute_referral_rate_sf
docs: * In token, with `mint_decimals`
* Actually an I68F60, stored as a u128 (i.e. BN) in Kamino.

fields.name: token_program
docs: Token or Token22. If token22, note that Kamino does not support all Token22 extensions.

fields.name: collateral_mint_pubkey
docs: Mints collateral tokens
* A PDA
* technically 6 decimals, but uses `mint_decimals` regardless for all purposes
* authority = lending_market_authority

fields.name: mint_total_supply
docs: Total number of collateral tokens
* uses `mint_decimals`, even though it's technically 6 decimals under the hood

fields.name: collateral_supply_vault
docs: * A PDA

types.name: PanicState
docs: Panic state for emergency protocol pausing

fields.name: pause_flags
docs: Whether the protocol is currently paused (1 = paused, 0 = not paused)

fields.name: daily_pause_count
docs: Number of times paused today (resets every 24 hours)

fields.name: consecutive_pause_count
docs: Number of consecutive pauses (resets when unpause happens)

fields.name: pause_start_timestamp
docs: Timestamp when the current pause started (0 if not paused)
* When a pause is extended before expiring, this could be in the future.

fields.name: last_daily_reset_timestamp
docs: Timestamp of the last daily reset (for tracking daily pause count)

fields.name: _reserved_space
docs: Reserved for future use (making total struct 32 bytes)

types.name: PanicStateCache
docs: Cached panic state information for fast checking during user operations

fields.name: pause_flags
docs: Whether the protocol is currently paused (1 = paused, 0 = not paused)

fields.name: pause_start_timestamp
docs: Timestamp when the current pause started (0 if not paused)

fields.name: last_cache_update
docs: Timestamp when this cache was last updated

types.name: StakedSettings
docs: Unique per-group. Staked Collateral banks created under a group automatically use these
settings. Groups that have not created this struct cannot create staked collateral banks. When
this struct updates, changes must be permissionlessly propogated to staked collateral banks.
Administrators can also edit the bank manually, i.e. with configure_bank, to temporarily make
changes such as raising the deposit limit for a single bank.

fields.name: key
docs: This account's own key. A PDA derived from `marginfi_group` and `STAKED_SETTINGS_SEED`

fields.name: marginfi_group
docs: Group for which these settings apply

fields.name: oracle
docs: Generally, the Pyth push oracle for SOL

fields.name: _reserved0
docs: The following values are irrelevant because staked collateral positions do not support
borrowing.

fields.name: risk_tier
docs: WARN: You almost certainly want "Collateral", using Isolated risk tier makes the asset
worthless as collateral, and is generally useful only when creating a staked collateral pool
for rewards purposes only.

fields.name: risk_tier
docs: WARN: You almost certainly want "Collateral", using Isolated risk tier makes the asset
worthless as collateral, making all outstanding accounts eligible to be liquidated, and is
generally useful only when creating a staked collateral pool for rewards purposes only.
